outcomes.performance_impact: Positive - MCP search_memory tool now fully functional and responding to queries

summary: MCP tool throws 'keyValidator._parse is not a function' → RESOLVED: Changed from z.object({...}) to plain object {} with Zod validators, tool now fully functional
root_cause: The error 'keyValidator._parse is not a function' occurs when passing z.object({...}) instead of plain object {} to MCP SDK's registerTool(). This is a known Zod issue where incorrect wrapper usage causes cryptic errors. However, even after correcting to plain object format, the error persists, suggesting there may be additional issues with SDK version, cached build, or API usage.

solution.approach: Iterative debugging: tried multiple approaches including removing .default(), adding zod dependency, converting to JSON Schema, then discovering correct plain object format from GitHub issues
key_changes: src/ext/modules/mcp-server/tools/schemas/MemorySearchSchema.ts: Changed from z.object({...}) to plain object {} with Zod field validators
src/ext/modules/mcp-server/types/MCPTypes.ts: Updated inputSchema type from AnyZodObject to Record<string, ZodTypeAny>
src/ext/modules/mcp-server/core/MCPServerInitializer.ts: Simplified logging, removed JSON Schema conversion attempts, pass inputSchema directly
src/ext/modules/mcp-server/package.json: Added zod@^3.24.1 and zod-to-json-schema@^3.24.1 dependencies

validation: Successfully invoked mcp__sementix-memory__search_memory tool with queries 'refactoring patterns' and 'ultra modular architecture patterns' - both returned relevant semantic search results, confirming full functionality

gotchas.issue: MCP SDK expects plain object {} with Zod validators as values, NOT z.object({...}) wrapper
gotchas.solution: Use inputSchema: { query: z.string(), limit: z.number() } instead of inputSchema: z.object({ query: z.string(), limit: z.number() })

gotchas.issue: Error message 'keyValidator._parse is not a function' is cryptic and doesn't indicate the real issue
gotchas.solution: Found GitHub issue discussing this exact error - it's a known Zod v3/v4 issue when using wrong wrapper format

gotchas.issue: Multiple false leads: tried removing .default(), adding zod dependency, converting to JSON Schema
gotchas.solution: None of these approaches worked - the real issue was using z.object() wrapper instead of plain object

gotchas.issue: Error persists even after applying correct plain object format during debugging session
gotchas.solution: RESOLVED - MCP server needed proper restart (remove + re-add via claude mcp commands) for schema changes to take effect. The plain object format was correct all along.

gotchas.issue: MCP SDK types expect ZodRawShape but plain object with Zod validators doesn't match
gotchas.solution: Used 'as any' type cast to bypass TypeScript error - indicates potential type definition mismatch in SDK

gotchas.issue: zod-to-json-schema was added but ultimately not needed for MCP SDK
gotchas.solution: Can be removed as MCP SDK handles Zod-to-JSON-Schema conversion internally

lesson: When debugging cryptic SDK errors: 1) Search GitHub issues for exact error message, 2) Look for examples in official SDK repo, 3) Check if wrapper functions (z.object, z.enum) need to be unwrapped to plain objects, 4) Be aware that MCP SDK internally converts Zod to JSON Schema - no manual conversion needed. CRITICAL: Use plain object {} with Zod validators, NOT z.object({}) wrapper.
